title.narrative: Improving the productivity and environmental sustainability of farming systems for 1,000 women farmers in Ghana

description.narrative: The project will assist women subsistence farmers in Ghana to improve the sustainability of their farming systems and help them adapt to the impacts of climate change. The results will be increased productivity and incomes, as well as improved food and nutrition security for women farmers, their families and their communities. Their communities will benefit further from long term availability of forest resources and increased access to potable water. ;

mailing-address.narrative: P.M.B., G.P.O., Accra, Ghana, West Africa

name.narrative: Tain District and Tano South District in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana

description.narrative: The project is being implemented with women farmers living in rural marginalised target communities

sector.narrative: We are educating the women about climate change impacts, mitigation and adaptation so they can be better prepared and adapt their farming systems to the impacts
We are helping women farmers increase their food crop production through training in organic farming and agroforestry and increased crop diversity and improved productivity to increase productivity
We are providing rural marginalised communities with boreholes for a sustainable supply of potable water
We are training the women farmers in climate change adaptation, organic farming and agroforestry

description.narrative: Funding from DFID for the first quarter of the first year of this activity (1 July 2013 - 30 September 2013)
Funding from DFID for the first quarter of the third year of this activity (Apr-Jun 2015)

This is an aggregate sum of all the expenditures during the first quarter of this project, and includes, for example, provision of boreholes and pumps, rainwater harvesting systems, food processing equipment, hoes and cutlasses, computer and accessories, rubber boots, construction materials, bags of cement and consultancy services etc
